Issues.Title: Fix vite3 postcss statSync not found
Issues.Body: I use tailwind+vite3+tauri to build my application, and I will get the above error. It seems to be `cwd()` has changed when fs.Statsync is called. Using an absolute address can better ensure the correct path of the files
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix vite3 postcss statSync not found" (#9032)

Issues.Title: Using CSS variable or alpha-value in `theme.ringColor.DEFAULT` doesn't work
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.1.7

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

vite 3.0.4

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v14.14.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/V7MWdx7jh3

**Describe your issue**

Using a CSS variable for `theme.ringColor.DEFAULT` in the Tailwind config makes Tailwind use its default value instead of the specified one.

None of these values work:
- `rgb(var(--primary, 113 97 236) / <alpha-value>)`
- `rgb(var(--primary, 113 97 236))`
- `var(--primary, rgb(113 97 236))`
- `rgb(113 97 236 / <alpha-value>)`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using CSS variable or alpha-value in `theme.ringColor.DEFAULT` doesn't work" (#9016)

Issues.Title: Separator not forcing usage
Issues.Body:
Tailwind not forced on use of different separator
Live example have same issue: https://play.tailwindcss.com/3Ic58ImPqc (styles apply which is bug)

Separator is required to separate added styles from other existing systems

Maybe this is because of weird one? Then need to be some documentation what is allowed
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Separator not forcing usage" (#9015)

Issues.Title: Drop-Shadow class breaks child absolute positioning
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.1.7 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "postcss": "^8.4.14", "node": "16.9.0", svelte kit **What version of Node.js are you using?** "node": "16.9.0" **What browser are you using?** Chrome latest **What operating system are you using?** Windows 10 ```

A

B

C

Are you sure?

``` **Describe your issue** When adding the drop-shadow to an element it breaks child absolute/fixed positioning. Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead. The modal appears inside the div but should be absolute visible outside the parent. To get the expected result remove the drop-shadow from the top div.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drop-Shadow class breaks child absolute positioning" (#9028)

Issues.Title: When defining dash-prefixed utility classes in a @layer, using them in an @apply statement throws a build error
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwind v3.1.7

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Tailwindcss CLI tool

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Node v16.6.2

**What browser are you using?**

N/A, CLI issue

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

Repo with basic demo code: https://github.com/lform/tailwind-dash-demo

**Describe your issue**

We're creating some utility classes in a `@layer utilities` layer that extend each other using `@apply` statements to create a simple header font-sizing system that utilizes modular scale. 

The classes work fine except if you try to use a dash-prefixed class thats been defined in the utilites layer in one of the `@apply` statements. There are workarounds but they would break the consistency of using the dash-prefix for negative values that tailwind employs uniformly. We're building out some re-usable components and want to utilize those font-sizing classes in them so this is a bit of a hindrence. We've temporarily changed the syntax to `h-ms--1` to work around this but its not ideal as it doesnt obey the consistency.

The above repo has the full code demo but basically the following is the problem:

```
@layer utilities {
	.h-ms {
		/* Works fine */
		@apply font-header leading-tight;
	}

	.h-ms-1 {
		/* Works fine */
		@apply h-ms text-ms-1 font-bold;
	}

	.-h-ms-1 {
		/* Works fine, `-text-ms-1` is defined in the tailwind config */
		@apply h-ms -text-ms-1 font-bold;
	}

	.new-class {
		/* This throws the below error */
		@apply -h-ms-1 italic;
	}
}
```

Which then throws the following error (the error goes away if you remove the offending dash-prefixed item in question from the apply statement):
```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'parent' of undefined
    at Root.normalize (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/postcss/lib/container.js:292:15)
    at Root.normalize (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/postcss/lib/root.js:25:23)
    at Root.insertAfter (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/postcss/lib/container.js:201:22)
    at Rule.after (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/postcss/lib/node.js:161:17)
    at processApply (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/expandApplyAtRules.js:453:16)
    at /Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/expandApplyAtRules.js:471:9
    at /Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/processTailwindFeatures.js:55:50
    at Object.Once (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/cli.js:682:27)
    at LazyResult.runOnRoot (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:337:23)
    at LazyResult.runAsync (/Users/bmf/sites/tailwind-dash-test/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:393:26)
```

Is there another way to approach this that would work? Not sure if this is a bug, expected or the wrong way to create these utility classes. Open to suggestions if there's a more correct approach, was unable to find any help when searching this issue online.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When defining dash-prefixed utility classes in a @layer, using them in an @apply statement throws a build error" (#9023)

Issues.Title: Fix `@apply` of user utilities when negative and non-negative versions both exist
Issues.Body:
`-foo-1` and `foo-1` are both matches for the class `-foo-1` but `@apply` only wants the first one. It would remove the second one and cause an error because it’s an entirely separate match that had its only rule removed 😱 

Fixes #9023
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix `@apply` of user utilities when negative and non-negative versions both exist" (#9027)

Issues.Title: Unable to run CLI, access error for something it really shouldn't be accessing
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/9005
Originally posted by **Lancelotbronner** August 1, 2022 On running the following command (on macOS): ```console npx tailwindcss -i tailwind.src.css -o wwwroot/css/tailwind.out.css ``` With the following `package.json`: ```json { "devDependencies": { "tailwindcss": "^3.1.7" } } ``` I get the following error, the CLI cannot access my backup drive, something it really shouldn't be trying to scan. ``` node:fs:1450 handleErrorFromBinding(ctx); ^ Error: EACCES: permission denied, scandir '/Volumes/MyBackupDrive' at Object.readdirSync (node:fs:1450:3) at readdirWithFileTypes (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.scandir/out/providers/sync.js:16:33) at Object.read (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.scandir/out/providers/sync.js:10:16) at SyncReader.scandirSync [as _scandir] (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.scandir/out/index.js:18:17) at SyncReader._handleDirectory (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.walk/out/readers/sync.js:28:34) at SyncReader._handleQueue (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.walk/out/readers/sync.js:23:18) at SyncReader.read (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.walk/out/readers/sync.js:15:14) at SyncProvider.read (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.walk/out/providers/sync.js:11:29) at ReaderSync.walkSync [as _walkSync] (/[redacted]/node_modules/@nodelib/fs.walk/out/index.js:20:21) at ReaderSync.dynamic (/[redacted]/node_modules/fast-glob/out/readers/sync.js:13:21) { errno: -13, syscall: 'scandir', code: 'EACCES', path: '/Volumes/MyBackupDrive' } Node.js v18.4.0 ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to run CLI, access error for something it really shouldn't be accessing" (#9019)

Issues.Title: Disable color form rgba to hex
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v3.1.2 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** For example: react@18 vitejs@2.8.6 **What version of Node.js are you using?** For example: v16.16.0 **What browser are you using?** For example: Chrome **What operating system are you using?** For example: macOS 12.1 **Describe your issue** Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead 1. When i define some custom color with rgba in tailwind.config.js ``` module.exports = { content: [ // Example content paths... './public/**/*.html', './src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx,vue}', ], theme: { extend: { colors: { 'font-primary': 'rgba(51, 51, 64, 0.88)', 'font-secondary': 'rgba(71, 71, 101, 0.55)', 'font-tertiary': 'rgba(58, 58, 89, 0.33)', 'font-quarternary': 'rgba(61, 61, 89, 0.18)', }, }, }, } ``` 2. Use in jsx `

User

` 3. Work as expect in develop env ![2967AE02-266B-41B5-9B63-DD2A7E8E50BB](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13961032/182590764-9d0546ad-bd8b-4339-86a6-164400de92c4.png) 4. Transfromed rrggbbaa(hex) after build in production env ![14751D1B-90B3-497A-9682-801628348EAA](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13961032/182591524-dcd5737e-03e8-4394-ab8c-bd45a50c040b.png) 5. I just want to use rgba color instead of hex(In fact, rrggbbaa color does not working in some broswer).So Is there some way i can disable this option? THANKS

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom color opacity in theme function" (#8991)

Issues.Title: Fix resolution of alpha values inside color functions
Issues.Body:
The default config in Tailwind CSS makes `theme.colors` a function that gets resolved. This coupled with a single-level custom color function or alpha value didn't work (e.g. `theme('colors.primary / 50%')`) whereas colors with 2+ levels worked fine. This was caused by an off-by-1 error when determining whether or not things needed to be resolved as a function.

> There are 2 hard problems in computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, and off-by-1 errors.

Fixes #8991
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix resolution of alpha values inside color functions" (#9008)

Issues.Title: Exclude prettier rule in ESLint
Issues.Body: This PR intend to exclude prettier rule in ESLint. Mainly to prevent to display squiggly lines about `prettier/prettier` in editor, **red lines in `prettier/prettier` in vscode** **This PR change** - remove about `eslint-plugin-prettier` settings in `eslintrc.json`.- - append prettier command in `style` script in `package.json` **references** https://prettier.io/docs/en/integrating-with-linters.html#notes
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Exclude prettier rule in ESLint" (#8990)

Issues.Title: "info - Tailwind CSS is watching for changes..." is duplicated in the CLI output
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.0.0

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Angular CLI + @angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v12.22.12

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

N/A

**Describe your issue**

Hello there!

I'm trying to utilize TailwindCSS in my Angular project and noticed that a dev process (the one that's watching for file changes) started to fail with OOM error. When I rename my `tailwind.config.js` file (to disable TailwindCSS watcher) I get no OOM even if the process continues working for hours.

One suspicious thing that I'm noticing when watching CLI output is these lines:
```
[watch] - Generating browser application bundles...
[watch]
[watch] info - Tailwind CSS is watching for changes...
info - https://tailwindcss.com/docs/just-in-time-mode#watch-mode-and-one-off-builds
[watch]
[watch] info - Tailwind CSS is watching for changes...
[watch] info - https://tailwindcss.com/docs/just-in-time-mode#watch-mode-and-one-off-builds
```

Can you please help me understand and come up with a fix for the issue? I really love the TailwindCSS concept but these OOMs are driving me crazy.

Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""info - Tailwind CSS is watching for changes..." is duplicated in the CLI output" (#9002)

Issues.Title: Remove class prefix in arbitrary variant that is used multiple times
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in #8932

Fixes the issue when a class prefix is configured and an arbitrary variant with a class name is used within the variant, the class within the variant would have the class prefix when the same arbitrary variant is used more than once.

Extension of PR #8773.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove class prefix in arbitrary variant that is used multiple times" (#8992)

Issues.Title: Centered the project name
Issues.Body:
A centered project name makes documentation much better looking and appealing.

<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Centered the project name" (#9000)

Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ✳️ eslint (8.19.0 → 8.20.0) · [Repo](https://github.com/eslint/eslint) · [Changelog](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

8.20.0

Features

Bug Fixes

Documentation

Chores

  • bbf8df4 chore: Mark autogenerated release blog post as draft (#16130) (Nicholas C. Zakas)
  • eee4306 chore: update internal lint dependencies (#16088) (Bryan Mishkin)
  • 9615a42 chore: update formatter examples template to avoid markdown lint error (#16085) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 62541ed chore: fix markdown linting error (#16083) (唯然)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 21 commits:

  • 8.20.0
  • Build: changelog update for 8.20.0
  • chore: Mark autogenerated release blog post as draft (#16130)
  • docs: Add website team details (#16115)
  • docs: Link to blog post in no-constant-binary-expression (#16112)
  • docs: remove install command (#16084)
  • fix: no-warning-comments rule escapes special RegEx characters in terms (#16090)
  • feat: catch preprocess errors (#16105)
  • docs: don't show toc when content not found (#16095)
  • docs: enhance 404 page UI (#16097)
  • fix: ignore spacing before `]` and `}` in comma-spacing (#16113)
  • docs: remove unused meta.docs.category field in working-with-rules page (#16109)
  • docs: add formatters page edit link (#16094)
  • docs: preselect default theme (#16098)
  • docs: add missing correct/incorrect containers (#16087)
  • docs: fix UI bug on rules index and details pages (#16082)
  • docs: remove remaining duplicate rule descriptions (#16093)
  • docs: Add scroll behaviour smooth (#16056)
  • chore: update internal lint dependencies (#16088)
  • chore: update formatter examples template to avoid markdown lint error (#16085)
  • chore: fix markdown linting error (#16083)

Issues.Title: Extended rem value not applied without space
Issues.Body:
Next.js project using version 12.1.6 and tailwindcss version ^3.0.24.

I have extended a few properties in tailwind.config.js, when extending the minHeight like so: 

```
minHeight: {
  20: '5 rem',
  'product-preview': '85 rem',
},
```

The rem is applied, but it is **not** applied when setting it like this (as the documentation suggests):
```
minHeight: {
  20: '5rem',
  'product-preview': '85rem',
},
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Extended rem value not applied without space" (#8993)

Issues.Title: Gradient stop breaks with mediaquery
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

@astrojs/tailwind: ^0.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Astro

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

16.5.1

**What browser are you using?**

N/A, tried Chrome and Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

[**Reproduction URL**](https://play.tailwindcss.com/V8VenQzI76)

**Describe your issue**

Gradient breaks when using media queries in a specific way.

```
<div class="bg-gradient-to-b from-black/0 via-black sm:via-black/50 to-black absolute inset-0" />
```

Works fine on smalles screens, but when bigger it breaks. Goes black/0 > black-50 > black/0, instead of Goes black/0 > black-50 > black/100.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Gradient stop breaks with mediaquery" (#8978)

Issues.Title: Tailwind doesnt allow forcing !important with selector in place
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

vite 3.0.3

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

16.14.10

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox 101/Chromium 103

**What operating system are you using?**

Fedora 36

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/2OCzJLtC9x

**Describe your issue**

Tailwind allows 2 modes for important application:
Mode 1 lets me go with !important on all styles
Mode 2 with just a selector.

However many common frameworks exist that share styles with tailwind and override them with !important if i only use a selector.
For these Tailwind would need to allow me to not only use the selector but also mark the generated styles as !important by default.

So important: '#selector', forceimportant: true
Or something similar.

Else i'd be forced to override each style bootstrap happens to share on an existing page with !p-2 or !px-2 - and hoping bootstrap doesnt add any more on updates.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind doesnt allow forcing !important with selector in place" (#8979)

Issues.Title: Preflight improvement on fieldset
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v3.1.6 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Angular 13 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.0.0 **What browser are you using?** Firefox **What operating system are you using?** Windows **Describe your issue** Current preflight reset for fieldset is below. The problem with fieldset is truncate does not work within fieldset. Due to the minimum width default for fieldset. ```CSS fieldset { margin: 0; padding: 0; } ``` Suggest change. ```CSS fieldset { min-width: 0; margin: 0; padding: 0; } ``` Today, I have spent more than an hour to try to figure out what's going on with truncate. To avoid others fall into this trap, it would be good to provide as default. Without `min-width:0` following truncate won't work. ```HTML
Aliquet nec orci mattis amet quisque ullamcorper neque, nibh sem. At arcu, sit dui mi, nibh dui, diam eget aliquam. Quisque id at vitae feugiat egestas ac. Diam nulla orci at in viverra scelerisque eget. Eleifend egestas fringilla sapien.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Preflight improvement on fieldset" (#8972)

Issues.Title: A11y issue : semantics on Lists being removed with Safari as list-style: none is a default.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
React v18.2.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v16.14.2

**What browser are you using?**
Safari v15.5

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS Monterey v12.4

**Reproduction URL**
Create a basic React app with CRA for instance, add a list `<ul>` with a few elements. Launch VoiceOver and go through the page content to find the list. VoiceOver does not announce any list and just reads each `<li>` element text. 

**Describe your issue**
Because `list-style: none` is applied as default by Tailwind, semantics are removed as aknowledged by different people working on accessibility (check this post : https://www.scottohara.me/blog/2019/01/12/lists-and-safari.html).
I understand why native styles are removed as default (they are usually reset) and this is more a Safari issue. Yet, as tailwind reaches almost 3M downloads per week (https://www.npmjs.com/package/tailwindcss), this behaviour may have a significant impact. Of course, it's up to Safari developers to fix this on their side if they're willing to. Meanwhile, an alternative to default styles for lists should be provided, or at least something in the docs to notify tailwind users about this issue. 

One hack to restore semantics when `list-style: none` is applied : https://gerardkcohen.me/writing/2017/voiceover-list-style-type.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A11y issue : semantics on Lists being removed with Safari as list-style: none is a default." (#8975)

Issues.Title: Incorrect work of url() in css file when using vite.js
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "3.1.6"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"vite": "3.0.3"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.16.0

**What browser are you using?**

Any

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows (WSL2)

**Reproduction URL**
https://codesandbox.io/s/vite-tailwind-bug-jm7w9h

**Describe your issue**

If vite.config.js entry point is a style file, for example, for a classic backend, then the url() in css files are not processed.
But if I comment out the tilewindcss plugin in the postcss.config.js file, then everything works fine.

Result with tailwindcss: (not processed)
```
.test{background-image:url(img.svg)}
```
Result without tailwindcss: (processed)
```
.test{background-image:url(/img-8dac5379.svg)}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect work of url() in css file when using vite.js" (#8966)

Issues.Title: Don't rewrite source maps for `@layer` rules
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Don't rewrite source maps for `@layer` rules" (#8971)

Issues.Title: Update jest: 28.1.2 → 28.1.3 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ✳️ jest (28.1.2 → 28.1.3) · [Repo](https://github.com/facebook/jest) · [Changelog](https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

28.1.3

Features

  • [jest-leak-detector] Use native FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external C dependency (#12973)

Fixes

  • [jest-changed-files] Fix a lock-up after repeated invocations (#12757)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • [jest-mock] Add index signature support for spyOn types (#13013, #13020)
  • [jest-snapshot] Fix indentation of awaited inline snapshots (#12986)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [*] Replace internal usage of pretty-format/ConvertAnsi with jest-serializer-ansi-escapes (#12935, #13004)
  • [docs] Update spyOn docs (#13000)

New Contributors

  • @joshkel made their first contribution in #12960
  • @enrilzhou made their first contribution in #12973
  • @milahu made their first contribution in #12983
  • @MiguelYax made their first contribution in #13000
  • @kaffarell made their first contribution in #13015
  • @TheKhanj made their first contribution in #12988
  • @Fdawgs made their first contribution in #13019

Full Changelog: v28.1.2...v28.1.3

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 25 commits:

  • v28.1.3
  • chore: update changelog for release
  • chore: update docusaurus (#13021)
  • refactor(jest-mock): simplify `PropertyLikeKeys` utility type (#13020)
  • fix: missing spaces in string concats (#13019)
  • chore: bump `typescript` and related dependencies (#13017)
  • Update JestCommunity.md (#12988)
  • chore: update react-native example (#13016)
  • chore: fixed changelog.md typo (#13015)
  • chore: update babel
  • chore: update lint dependencies (#13014)
  • Update spyOn docs (#13000)
  • Refine babel-plugin-jest-hoist typings (#13011)
  • fix(jest-mock): add index signature support for `spyOn` types (#13013)
  • fix(scripts): also check for package.json (#12983)
  • chore: bump `jest-serialiser-ansi-escapes` (#13004)
  • chore: replace `pretty-format/ConvertAnsi` with `jest-serializer-ansi-escapes` (#12935)
  • docs: minor grammar correction from "as document" to "as documented" (#12995)
  • Correct `await`-ed inline snapshot indentation (#12986)
  • feat(jest-leak-detector): use FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external dependency (#12973)
  • chore: bump `jest-runner-tsd` (#12981)
  • fix: Switch from throat to p-limit (#12960)
  • feat: upgrade TypeBox (#12979)
  • fix(expect-utils): Fix equalityof ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • chore: update lockfile after release
